SENT.plain: AIMS: Currently, there are no available data on the incidence of type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM) in the Philippines
A cohort derived from a national study population (FNRI-NNS, 1998) was revisited after 9 years to yield valuable data on glucose homeostasis among Filipinos
METHODS: Six out of 13 national regions were included in the cohort
1386 (95.9%) consented to a fasting blood glucose (FBG) test, and 1275 (88.2%) completed the 2h post-glucose (2HPG) load determination using whole blood capillary samples
RESULTS: We observed a significant increase of mean FBGs (91.5mg/dL to 103.3mg/dL) from 1998 to 2007
The prevalence of pre-diabetes, i.e., combined impaired fasting glucose (IFG) and impaired glucose tolerance (IGT) was 31.3%; IFG was 17.5% and IGT was 23.9%
CONCLUSIONS: The study shows the alarming growth of diabetes, IFG, and IGT in our country that warrants early aggressive intervention for prevention and management
We encourage the use of 2h post-glucose load aside from FBG in screening for true diabetics, IFGs, and IGTs
